content.raw: I've tested detaching and re-attaching at a weird pose (`1 2 3 4 5 6`) but the joint axis differs between ODE and dart
content.html: I've tested detaching and re-attaching at a weird pose (1 2 3 4 5 6) but the joint axis differs between ODE and dart

content.raw: I'm not sure which is correct
content.html: I'm not sure which is correct

content.raw: it seems like ode is interpreting the joint axis in the global frame, so maybe it has `use_parent_model_frame` == true?
content.html: it seems like ode is interpreting the joint axis in the global frame, so maybe it has use_parent_model_frame == true?

I think the following will fix it:

diff -r 91c16588e936 gazebo/physics/Joint.cc
--- a/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc   Fri Aug 18 14:00:33 2017 -0700
+++ b/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc   Fri Aug 18 14:04:52 2017 -0700
@@ -67,9 +67,8 @@
   this->stopStiffness[1] = 1e8;
   this->stopDissipation[1] = 1.0;
   // these flags are related to issue #494
-  // set default to true for backward compatibility
-  this->axisParentModelFrame[0] = true;
-  this->axisParentModelFrame[1] = true;
+  this->axisParentModelFrame[0] = false;
+  this->axisParentModelFrame[1] = false;

   if (!this->sdfJoint)
   {

content.raw: we may want to backport this to gazebo7
content.html: we may want to backport this to gazebo7

content.raw: ~~But what about [this comment](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/91c16588e936649670e66909ae05ba344e94126d/gazebo/physics/Joint.cc?fileviewer=file-view-default#Joint.cc-153)?~~
content.html: But what about this comment?

content.raw:
Although it seems inconsistent with the comment in pull request #963:
"Models written in sdf 1.5 without the use_parent_model_frame tag will be given a default value of false (better behavior). So we will need to communicate this change to our users writing new models, but old models will still work."
content.html: Although it seems inconsistent with the comment in pull request #963: "Models written in sdf 1.5 without the use_parent_model_frame tag will be given a default value of false (better behavior). So we will need to communicate this change to our users writing new models, but old models will still work."

content.raw: Also, false would be consistent [with sdformat](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/sdformat/src/06eff281aba7a67a75f046578b925e3ca57ef4bc/sdf/1.5/joint.sdf?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#joint.sdf-54).
content.html: Also, false would be consistent with sdformat.

content.raw: I made the change in dd3c60f. For some reason the DART joint had an [extra transform](#!/osrf/gazebo/src/1054201b80f7768d4f163a73df137a7ecc9e2e3e/gazebo/physics/dart/DARTSliderJoint.cc?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#DARTSliderJoint.cc-116) that effectively reversed the model frame (i.e. if axisParentModelFrame was true it used the joint frame and if axixParentModelFrame was false it used the model frame). So, I fixed that as well.
content.html: I made the change in dd3c60f. For some reason the DART joint had an extra transform that effectively reversed the model frame (i.e. if axisParentModelFrame was true it used the joint frame and if axixParentModelFrame was false it used the model frame). So, I fixed that as well.

content.raw:
I thought about this problem a little more over the weekend, and I think this happens because we don't pass the sdf string through the joint.sdf parser, so it doesn't add the required parameters.

It would also be nice to check the GlobalAxis of the joint in the harness test.

I'll suggest patches for these changes.
content.html:
I thought about this problem a little more over the weekend, and I think this happens because we don't pass the sdf string through the joint.sdf parser, so it doesn't add the required parameters.

It would also be nice to check the GlobalAxis of the joint in the harness test.

I'll suggest patches for these changes.

content.raw:
take a look at branch `dart_harness_scpeters`:

* e3d175927a77: add a test for GlobalAxis to tests that detach and re-attach the harness
* 11a1a0e686ea: parse the joint sdf elements before creating a joint

I believe the second commit would also work even without the changes to Joint.cc in dd3c60f, but it doesn't hurt to have both
content.html:
take a look at branch dart_harness_scpeters:

  • e3d175927a77: add a test for GlobalAxis to tests that detach and re-attach the harness
  • 11a1a0e686ea: parse the joint sdf elements before creating a joint

I believe the second commit would also work even without the changes to Joint.cc in dd3c60f, but it doesn't hurt to have both

content.raw: Thanks! Merged in 297ff9e. I modified the test slightly to calculate the expected axis on the fly. I also tested with `axisParentModelFrame` initialized to true and it worked.
content.html: Thanks! Merged in 297ff9e. I modified the test slightly to calculate the expected axis on the fly. I also tested with axisParentModelFrame initialized to true and it worked.

content.raw: Why are you removing `DARTModel::BackupState` and `DARTModel::RestoreState`?
content.html: Why are you removing DARTModel::BackupState and DARTModel::RestoreState?

content.raw: They assumed a fixed number of DOFs, which is not the case when adding/removing joints. The assertion would fail.
content.html: They assumed a fixed number of DOFs, which is not the case when adding/removing joints. The assertion would fail.

content.raw: I would change the asserts to `if` statements and print error messages if the sizes don't match. We could also change this function to return `bool` and return `false` when failing to restore.
content.html: I would change the asserts to if statements and print error messages if the sizes don't match. We could also change this function to return bool and return false when failing to restore.

content.raw: Sounds good. I have added them back in 3b96a3f. They are still no longer called in `DARTPhysics::Reset` because I had added code to reset the joint positions in `DARTJoint::Reset`, which works even if the number of joints has changed.
content.html: Sounds good. I have added them back in 3b96a3f. They are still no longer called in DARTPhysics::Reset because I had added code to reset the joint positions in DARTJoint::Reset, which works even if the number of joints has changed.

content.raw: Thanks. We could deprecate those functions if we don't think they have a purpose.
content.html: Thanks. We could deprecate those functions if we don't think they have a purpose.

content.raw: They are a convenient way to set all the joints together, and I don't think they should cause any problems with the if statements now
content.html: They are a convenient way to set all the joints together, and I don't think they should cause any problems with the if statements now

content.raw: The `DARTModel::CreateJoint` functions are mostly the same; they differ only by a single line (`auto joint = ...`). Do you mind moving the shared code to a private function called `DARTModel::CreateJointHelper` (or something)?
content.html: The DARTModel::CreateJoint functions are mostly the same; they differ only by a single line (auto joint = ...). Do you mind moving the shared code to a private function called DARTModel::CreateJointHelper (or something)?

content.raw:
I've looked into these test failures, and I think one of the changes that were merged into this PR may have introduced some memory leaks for DARTJoint objects. We probably didn't catch it before this PR, because the test used to be disabled.

Before the merge, this test was passing on this PR. The test has a segfault if we try to run it for DART on the `default` branch, so it's hard to say exactly where the memory leak may be coming from.

I don't think it makes sense to block this PR on an issue that it revealed but didn't cause. I'd suggest we re-disable the test for DART and open an issue for it.
content.html:
I've looked into these test failures, and I think one of the changes that were merged into this PR may have introduced some memory leaks for DARTJoint objects. We probably didn't catch it before this PR, because the test used to be disabled.

Before the merge, this test was passing on this PR. The test has a segfault if we try to run it for DART on the default branch, so it's hard to say exactly where the memory leak may be coming from.

I don't think it makes sense to block this PR on an issue that it revealed but didn't cause. I'd suggest we re-disable the test for DART and open an issue for it.

content.raw: I've opened an issue for this: #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2469/
content.html: I've opened an issue for this: #!/osrf/gazebo/issues/2469/
